text.p: These are some of the leading stories in the Greek Cypriot press on Thursday. Reuters has not verified these reports and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- The government expresses its satisfaction with the decision of the United States and the European Union to coordinate their efforts over Cyprus.
- A broad House majority is secured for the passing of the 1997 budget.
- Disy official Anastassiades fuels speculation as Disy leadership strife deepens.
- Germany proposes a plan for a comprehensive solution to the Cyprus problem.
- By the end of 1995 the debt and spending on defence is expected to accumulate to one billion pounds, says Communist Akel MP.
- Members of Disy look to President Glafcos Clerides to calm the waters in the party.
- Retail interest rates charged by commercial banks are set to lower by half a percentage point by March 1.
- Disy pushes ahead with elections in early March. The "battle" now lies in gaining a senior post in the party.
